thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Reporting companies buoy NZ sharemarket

author: news.com.au
title: Reporting companies buoy NZ sharemarket
text:
NEW Zealand shares have climbed as Meridian Energy, Fletcher Building and Precinct Properties New Zealand advanced on positive financial results.
THE S&P/NZX 50 Index rose 39.25 points, 0.7 per cent, to 5,750.02 on Wednesday.
Within the index, 22 stocks rose, 19 fell and nine were unchanged. Turnover was $140 million. Meridian gained 2.7 per cent to $2.25 after the country's biggest electricity generator lifted annual earnings 5.6 per cent to $585m. "It was a good result from them ahead of the prospectus forecast and a special dividend now," said Mark Lister, head of private wealth research at Craigs Investment Partners. "It's more good news and it's been a great performer since listing and has been rewarded today for a good result." Fletcher rose 2.8 per cent to $5.65, after its pretax earnings rose in line with guidance. Precinct rose 0.9 per cent to $1.155. The property investor posted a 4.4 per cent increase in annual net profit. Sky Network Television led the benchmark index higher, up 2.9 per cent to $5.65 and Spark New Zealand rose 2.8 per cent to $2.785. Xero was the worst performer on the benchmark index, dropping 3.5 per cent to $15.24, its lowest level since December.
